blocks.text: The Elecraft K2 is a high-performance HF transceiver covering 160-10 meters. It features an LCD display with LED bargraph S-meter, dual VFOs, and extensive menu system. With options, it supports CW, SSB, and data modes up to 100 W.
The LCD shows ELECRAFT for two seconds on power-up. If a problem is detected, it displays INFO followed by a number corresponding to the Troubleshooting section.
Use BAND+ and BAND- to change bands. Hold BAND+ + BAND- together for direct frequency entry using the numeric keypad (e.g., 7040 for 7.040 MHz).
The mode indicator (C, L, U, or r) appears at the right of the display. A small bar above C or r indicates CW/DATA reverse sideband. The indicator flashes in CW TEST or SPEECH mode.
LCD annunciators show status: NB (noise blanker), ANT2, PRE (preamp), ATTN (attenuator), A/B (VFO), RIT, XIT, F (fast play).
Tap MENU to access the menu. The last-used entry is displayed with an underline. Scroll with the VFO knob or BAND+/BAND-. Hold EDIT to modify parameters, then tap MENU to exit.

blocks.name: ST P
blocks.description: Sidetone pitch: 0.40-0.80 kHz in 10 Hz steps.

blocks.name: INP
blocks.description: CW input: PDLn (paddle normal with auto-detect), PDLr (reversed), HAND (hand key/external keyer).

blocks.name: LCD
blocks.description: Display mode: DAY (backlight off, bargraph bright) or NITE (backlight on, bargraph normal).

blocks.name: OPT
blocks.description: Receiver optimization: PERF (performance) or BATT (battery saving mode).

blocks.name: PF1/PF2
blocks.description: Programmable functions. Can be assigned to any menu function, SCAN, or FPon (Fast-Play).

blocks.text: Connect any hand key, bug, or external keyer to the KEY jack, or use a paddle with the built-in memory keyer. A stereo plug is required. The KEYER knob adjusts speed from 9-50 WPM.
With auto-detect enabled (default), a computer, hand key, or external keyer can be connected along with the paddle. The K2 automatically detects which device is being used.
To record a message: Hold REC, then tap 0-8 to select a buffer. To play: Tap MSG, then tap 0-8. To chain messages or auto-repeat, hold the number instead of tapping.

blocks.name: RPT
blocks.description: CW message repeat interval: 0-255 seconds. Useful for beacons or calling CQ.

blocks.text: To test the keyer without transmitting, use VOX to enter CW TEST mode (mode letter flashes). Remember to exit test mode before operating.
The K2 supports up to four crystal filters (FL1-FL4), selected using XFIL. Hold XFIL + AGC to display the current filter number and bandwidth, plus audio filter setting if applicable.
Tap PRE/ATT to cycle through preamp (+14 dB) and attenuator (-10 dB). Hold SPOT for CW audio spot signal.
Tap AGC to select FAST or SLOW AGC. Hold PRE/ATT + AGC to turn AGC completely off (mode letter decimal point flashes as reminder).

blocks.name: NB
blocks.description: Tap NB to select noise blanker mode: OFF, NB1, or NB2. Hold LEVEL to toggle low/high threshold (NB annunciator flashes for low threshold).

blocks.text: With optional KAF2 audio filter, hold AFIL to select audio filter modes (AF1-2, CF1-4, SF1-4). Hold AFIL + SPLIT for DSP notch; AFIL + REC for DSP noise reduction.
Power the K2 from any 9-15 V DC supply. Current drain is typically 1.5-2 A transmit, but can exceed 3 A at highest power or high SWR. The optional KPA100 amplifier provides up to 100 W output.
If supply voltage drops below 11 V, LO BATT is displayed every 8 minutes. The CAL CUR menu sets maximum transmit current (recommended: 3.50 A). HI CUR is displayed if limit is reached.
The optional KBT2 internal battery (12 V, 2.9 Ah) can be charged using a 14.0 V supply. Disable internal battery when using external battery.
The optional KAT2 automatic antenna tuner provides accurate power control and display under all SWR conditions. Tap ANT1/2 to toggle between two antenna jacks.
Hold TUNE to key the transmitter and activate the ATU. The ATU automatically finds a match. Hold DISPLAY + TUNE to override the ATU power limit during tuning.

blocks.name: ATU
blocks.description: ATU operating mode. See KAT2 manual for details.

blocks.name: RANT
blocks.description: RX antenna: OFF or ON, per-band. Allows using a separate receive antenna.

blocks.text: If INFO followed by a number appears at power-up, refer to that paragraph in the Troubleshooting section of the manual.

blocks.name: LO BATT displayed
blocks.description: Supply voltage below 11 V. Reduce power and recharge. Use DISPLAY to check voltage/current.

blocks.name: HI CUR displayed
blocks.description: Transmit current exceeded CAL CUR limit. Reduce power or check antenna SWR.

blocks.name: Display blank but power on
blocks.description: Internal fuse F1 may have tripped due to short. Turn off power and check for the problem.

blocks.name: 50/60 Hz hum in receiver
blocks.description: K2 too close to equipment with large AC transformer. Move K2 away from the interference source.

blocks.name: Mode letter flashing
blocks.description: CW TEST mode or SPEECH (VOX) mode is active. Use VOX to toggle back to normal operation.
